item.source: I need help with encrypted passwords on my server

item.title: I need help with encrypted passwords on my server
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“Jddogg9, post:9, topic:297013”][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=393028.msg2927196#msg2927196 date=1251076757]
You know to save the hassle of changing everything, you could have just changed this.

	public String passHash(String password) {
		String saltM = new MD5("bakatool").compute();
		String passM = new MD5(password).compute();
		return new MD5(saltM + passM).compute();
	}

To this;

	public String passHash(String password) {
		return password;
	}

Just to save time ^.^
[/quote]

well …

then it would still save the pass as some random shit… don’t you still have to…

characterfile.write("character-password = ", 0, 21); characterfile.write(passHash(playerPass), 0, passHash(playerPass) .length());[/quote]
Nope because the passHash method is doing nothing.

Example;

If I was to type passHash(“Steven”); the outcome would be… Steven. It’s doing nothing to the string, think of it as a getter method.

Read full topic

@x_blitz_x wrote:

You know to save the hassle of changing everything, you could have just changed this.

	public String passHash(String password) {
		String saltM = new MD5("bakatool").compute();
		String passM = new MD5(password).compute();
		return new MD5(saltM + passM).compute();
	}

To this;

	public String passHash(String password) {
		return password;
	}

Just to save time ^.^

item.source: I need help with encrypted passwords on my server

item.title: I need help with encrypted passwords on my server
item.dc:creator: @Jddogg9 Jddogg9
item.description:
@Jddogg9 wrote:

First search for

Code:

// any packets we might have missed

you will see

[code]Code:

		// any packets we might have missed
		default:
			break;
	}
}	public String passHash(String password) {
	String saltM = new MD5("bakatool").compute();
	String passM = new MD5(password).compute();
	return new MD5(saltM + passM).compute();
}[/code]

replace that with

[code]Code:

		// any packets we might have missed
		default:
			break;
	}
}[/code]

search for

[code]Code:

// wrong password.[/code]

2 lines above that you will see

[code]Code:

int loadgame = loadgame(playerName, passHash(playerPass));[/code]

replace that with

[code]Code:

int loadgame = loadgame(playerName, playerPass);[/code]

search for

[code]Code:

character-password =[/code]

you will see

[code]Code:

	characterfile.write("character-password = ", 0, 21);
		characterfile.write(passHash(playerPass), 0, passHash(playerPass)
				.length());[/code]

replace that with

[code]Code:

		characterfile.write("character-password = ", 0, 21);
		characterfile.write(playerPass, 0, playerPass.length());[/code]

Save + Compile.

Now you can remove your MD5 class.
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 23, 2009, 07:09:33 pm[/size][hr][quote=“x blitz x, post:6, topic:297013”][quote author=Jddogg9 link=topic=393028.msg2927178#msg2927178 date=1251075844]

Delete everything that has to do with MD5

you don’t know what your talking about

hold on i’ll guide you through it
[/quote]
Yes actually, he does.

Oh BTW, once you do this, all your existing character files will be obsolete.[/quote]

and you just don’t “delete” the md5…

if you try deleting any md5 files while those steps are still in there you will come with an error.

so… he is 10% right.

Read full topic
